photo.description: Francesco Pinelli (1473) banquero genovés, rompe el viejo caserío sevillano, de lógicamente tradición islámica, con la introducción de la arquitectura doméstica renacentista. Esta casa-palacio es la primera manifestación sevillana del nuevo arte. Luego vendrá la famosa "Casa de Pilatos" y "de las Dueñas".
photo.tags: sevilla plateresco renacimiento casadelospinelos casadepilatos
photo.title: CASA DE LOS PINELOS (casa-palacio, siglo XVI)

photo.description: La Casa de Pilatos es un palacio situado en la ciudad de Sevilla, El edificio es una combinación de los estilos renacentista italiano y el mudéjar español. Esta considerada como el mas relevante prototipo de palacio andaluz
photo.tags: casapilatos palaciodemedinaceli arcos columnas puerta ventanas azulejos estatua hierroforjado renancentistaitaliano mudéjarespañol patio sevilla andalucia españa nikond60 fototetegil
photo.title: Puerta Ventanas Arcos Columnas y Estatua Casa Pilatos Sevilla

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. Very renaissance: statues of classical gods and heroes. Except here the surroundings are mudejar: the muslim style continued under catholic rule.
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla casadepilatos trip
photo.title: Renaissance

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. This palace was built in the 15th century and remains a family house. It is a mix of gothic, mudejar and renaissance styles. It is named Pilatos, because its plan is supposed to be similar to the plan of the palace of Pontius Pilatus in Jerusalem. In any case, the owner who ordered the renaissance styling did visit Jerusalem. This is the main patio. The stucco is mudejar, but the structure as a whole is very italian. The fountain in the middle has been imported from Genua.
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla casadepilatos mudejar renaissance trip
photo.title: Casa de Pilatos

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. Galleries and arches surrounding the main patio.
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla casadepilatos trip
photo.title: Patio

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. The stucco is mudejar style: the work of the muslim artists and artisans that continued after the reconquista.
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla casadepilatos trip
photo.title: Mudejar

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. A statue of the godess of wisdom and warriors in a mudejar setting. She is a copy of a roman statue, made in Italy.
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla casadepilatos trip
photo.title: Minerva

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. Arch leading from the dark, cool interior of the Casa de Pilatos into the blinding sunlight of the courtyard.
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla casadepilatos trip
photo.title: To the light

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. Artesonados; beautifully carved and painted ceilings.
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla casadepilatos trip
photo.title: Artesonado

photo.description: Sevilla, 20080506. The walls of the corridors and rooms of the Case de Pilatos are covered in colourful azulos (tiles), and the wooden artesonado ceilings are painted in as many colours
photo.tags: spain andalucia sevilla azulos casadepilatos trip
photo.title: Riot of colours

photo.tags: andalusia seville spain
photo.title: Ceiling at Casa de Pilatos
